intro: Sophia chirurgorum, commonly known as the surgical sophia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a smooth texture and a slightly aromatic scent. The botanical interest in Sophia chirurgorum lies in its historical use in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
